title: March 2007 audio rework

properties.name: description
properties.value: The March 2007 audio rework was a major rework of RuneScape’s music player that was released on 6 March 2007. As part of this rework, all of RuneScape’s existing songs were updated with new recording technology.

content:
Harmony (2004)
Harmony, 2004 version. Instruments digitally generated according to player's computer soundcard.
Harmony (modern)
Harmony, March 2007 version. Songs made with bank of built-in instruments and sound identical across all computers.

The March 2007 audio rework was a major rework of RuneScape’s music player that was released on 6 March 2007. As part of this rework, all of RuneScape’s existing songs were updated with new recording technology.

When the Music player was first released on 15 March 2004, the game's songs sounded significantly different than they do today. The music player was dependent on the soundcards of individual players' computers to play the tracks, making songs more digital-sounding and less like actual musical instruments were used in them. To address this, the music player was completely reworked in early 2007 - from March 2007 onwards, songs were created using a bank of instruments built into the game itself.[1] All existing songs (456 at the time of the update) were updated to better reflect the new music player's sound. Old School RuneScape uses the music system derived from the audio rework.

The last music tracks released prior to the rework were Creature Cruelty, Magic, Magic, Magic, Mutant Medley, and Work, Work, Work, all as part of the Tower of Life quest on 19 February 2007. The first music track released after the rework was Zombiism, alongside The Great Brain Robbery on the same day of the music update.

The original versions of each song can be found under the "Versions" section of articles for music tracks released prior to March 2007.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Update:The Feldip Hills are alive with the sound of muuuusic!
